thread.title: Area Roundup: Coal City wins IESA Class 3A baseball title
thread.title_full: Area Roundup: Coal City wins IESA Class 3A baseball title

title: Area Roundup: Coal City wins IESA Class 3A baseball title
text:
Area Roundup: Coal City wins IESA Class 3A baseball title Published: Sunday, Oct. 4, 2015 9:26 p.m. CDT By: STAFF REPORT 
EAST PEORIA – For the second time in three years, the Coal City baseball team is the IESA Class 3A state champion. Related Links Area Roundup: Coal City wins IESA Class 3A baseball title 
The Warriors, who won the title in 2013 and finished third last year, rolled through the field at the state finals this season, defeating Pekin Edison, 12-3, in the quarterfinals Friday. 
Then they defeated Normal Kingsley, 15-0, in the semifinals Saturday morning. The Coalers topped off the weekend by winning the title game, 10-0, over Homewood Hart on Saturday evening. 
In the title game, Coal City, which finished the year with a 27-1 record, jumped ahead 3-0 after the first inning and led 8-0 after two innings. 
That was more than enough for pitchers Payton Hutching and Connor Best. 
Hutchings threw the first two innings, striking out three and allowing two hits. Best threw the final three innings, giving up just one hit while striking out three. 
At the plate, Jack Bunton was 3 for 3 with a triple and two RBIs, while Austin Pullara had two hits. 
Hutchings drove in two runs. 
In the semifinals, Pullara hit a grand slam to highlight a seven-run third inning. 
Hutchings went three innings in that game, striking out six and allowing three hits, while Best finished up, fanning one in his one inning. 
Best had two hits and two RBIs, while Cody Rogers drove in two runs, as did Riley Ponio. 
VOLLEYBALL 
IMSA Tournament: Newark went 5-0 on Saturday to win the tournament title for the first time since 1999. 
The Lady Norse (16-5) beat Aurora Christian, 16-25, 25-23, 26-24, in the championship match. 
They defeated Leyden, 25-22, 25-2,3 in the semifinals. In pool play, Newark scored a 25-11, 25-22 win over Westmont, beat Chicago Kennedy, 25-23, 25-14, and downed Joliet Central, 25-18, 25-23. 
Gardner-South Wilmington 25-25, Tri-Point 11-16: G-SW (12-4, 5-2) got five kills and seven blocks from Marlana Ferrari, while Lexi Robinson had four kills and three blocks in the River Valley win Thursday. 
Celia Barna had seven assists and Sydney Perkins added 5. 
GIRLS SWIMMING 
Riverside-Brookfield 113, Morris 63: Leading the way for Morris was Alex Kaste, who won the 50 freestyle in 27.09 seconds and the 100 breaststroke in 1:18.43. 
Elizabeth Smith also took first place honors, as she won the 100 freestyle with a time of 1:01.08. 
Morris also won the diving competition behind Clarrisa Wignes and Carmen Terry.
